questions.text:
What value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$37.5\% \text{ of } 640 + 16\frac{2}{3}\% \text{ of } 480 - \sqrt{1024} = ?$$

What value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$(15 \times 24) \div 8 + 35\% \text{ of } 420 = ? + 18$$

What value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$\sqrt{1521} \times 4 + (13)^{2} - 65 = ? \times 5$$

What approximate value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$24.98\% \text{ of } 599.98 + 14.02 \times 12.99 = ? + \sqrt{399}$$

What value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$2\frac{3}{7} + 3\frac{1}{6} - 1\frac{1}{2} + 2\frac{1}{21} = ?$$

What value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$(320 \div 8) \times \sqrt{81} - 15 \times 12 = ?$$

$$65\% \text{ of } 400 + \sqrt{? } = 44\% \text{ of } 800 - 12$$

$$343^{1/3} \times 14 + 120\% \text{ of } 60 = ?^{2} + 49$$

$$\frac{1}{8} \text{ of } 384 - \frac{1}{6} \text{ of } 144 + ? = 11^{2}$$

$$(0.64)^{2} \div (0.512)^{1/3} \times (0.8)^{4} = (0.8)^{? + 3}$$

questions.solution:
I. $$x = 14, -14$$
II. $$(y-13)^2 = 0 \implies y = 13$$
14 > 13 but -14 < 13. Relationship cannot be determined? Wait. 
$$14 > 13$$, $$-14 < 13$$. No relation.

I. Factors of -24 sum to -5: -8, 3. $$x = 8, -3$$
II. Factors of -18 sum to 3: 6, -3. $$y = -6, 3$$
$$8 > -6, 8 > 3$$.
$$-3 > -6, -3 < 3$$. 
Relation broken. CND.

questions.text:
Solve for x and y:
I. $$x^{2} - 15x + 56 = 0$$
II. $$y = \sqrt{64}$$
questions.solution:
I. $$x = 7, 8$$
II. $$y = 8$$ (Principal root only)
$$x \le y$$. Or rather, 7 < 8 and 8 = 8. So $$x \le y$$.

questions.text:
Directions: Study the data given below and answer the following questions.
There are three companies A, B, and C. The total employees in A are 20% more than in B. The ratio of Males to Females in B is 3:2. Number of females in A is 40% of the total employees in A. Total employees in C is 450, which is 10% less than employees in B.

Find the number of males in Company A.
Using the data from the previous caselet, find the average number of female employees in companies B and C, if females in C are 40% of total employees in C.
questions.solution:
Females in B: B=500, ratio 3:2. Females = $$\frac{2}{5} \times 500 = 200$$.
Females in C: 40% of 450 = 180.
Average = $$\frac{200+180}{2} = 190$$.

questions.text: Using the data from the previous caselet, the number of males in B is what percent of the number of males in A?
questions.solution:
Males in B = 300. Males in A = 360.
$$\frac{300}{360} \times 100 = \frac{5}{6} \times 100 = 83.33\%$$

questions.text:
Study the table carefully.
Table shows items sold by 3 shops on 3 days.
Find the ratio of total items sold by P on Mon and Wed together to items sold by Q on Tue and Wed together.
Based on the table above, items sold by R on Tuesday is what percent more than items sold by P on Tuesday?
Based on the table, find the difference between average items sold by P on all days and average items sold by Q on all days.
A shopkeeper marks an article 40% above the cost price and gives a discount of 25%. If he makes a profit of Rs. 420, find the Cost Price.
A can do a piece of work in 20 days and B in 30 days. They started working together but A left 5 days before the work was completed. Find the total number of days taken to complete the work.
questions.solution:
Let total days = T.
A worked for T-5, B worked for T.
$$\frac{T-5}{20} + \frac{T}{30} = 1$$
$$3(T-5) + 2T = 60$$
$$3T - 15 + 2T = 60$$
$$5T = 75 \implies T = 15$$.
Correct answer is 15.

questions.text: A sum of money becomes Rs. 10,800 in 2 years and Rs. 13,500 in 3 years at Compound Interest. Find the rate of interest.
A vessel contains 60 liters of milk and water in the ratio 3:2. 20 liters of mixture is removed and replaced with 10 liters of milk. Find the new ratio of milk to water.
questions.solution:
Initial: Milk = 36, Water = 24.
Removed 20L (Ratio 3:2): Milk rem = 12, Water rem = 8.
Remaining: Milk = 24, Water = 16.
Added 10L Milk: New Milk = 34.
New Ratio = $$34 : 16 = 17 : 8$$.

questions.text: The ratio of ages of A and B 4 years ago was 5:6. 4 years hence, the ratio will be 7:8. Find the present age of C, who is 5 years older than A.
questions.solution:
Age gap: 8 years. Ratio gap: $$7-5=2$$ units.
2 units = 8 years. 1 unit = 4 years.
A's age 4 years ago = 20. Present = 24.
C = 24 + 5 = 29.

questions.text: A train passes a platform of length 200m in 20 seconds and a man standing on the platform in 10 seconds. Find the length of the train.
questions.solution:
Length L. Speed S.
$$L = S \times 10$$
$$L + 200 = S \times 20$$
$$10S + 200 = 20S \implies 10S = 200 \implies S = 20$$
$$L = 20 \times 10 = 200$$m.

questions.text: The perimeter of a square is equal to the circumference of a circle. If the area of the circle is 616 cm², find the area of the square.
questions.solution:
$$\pi r^2 = 616 \implies \frac{22}{7} r^2 = 616 \implies r^2 = 196 \implies r = 14$$.
Circumference = $$2 \times \frac{22}{7} \times 14 = 88$$ cm.
$$4a = 88 \implies a = 22$$.
Area = $$22^2 = 484$$.

questions.text: A boat covers 36 km upstream and 48 km downstream in 10 hours. If the speed of the current is 3 km/hr, find the speed of the boat in still water.
questions.solution:
$$\implies \frac{36}{v-3} + \frac{48}{v+3} = 10$$. 
By putting values from the options we get 9 satisfied. 
Solution:=9.

questions.text: Pipe A can fill a tank in 12 hours, Pipe B in 15 hours. Pipe C can empty it in 20 hours. If all three are opened together, how long will it take to fill the tank?
questions.solution:
LCM = 60.
Efficiencies: A=5, B=4, C=-3.
Total Eff = $$5+4-3 = 6$$.
Time = $$60/6 = 10$$ hours.

questions.text: The average weight of 20 students is 45 kg. If the teacher's weight is included, the average increases by 1 kg. Find the teacher's weight.
A invested Rs. 5000 and B invested Rs. 8000. After 4 months, A added Rs. 3000 and B withdrew Rs. 2000. Find the profit share of A at the end of a year out of a total profit of Rs. 4200.
questions.solution:
A: $$5000 \times 4 + 8000 \times 8 = 20k + 64k = 84k$$
B: $$8000 \times 4 + 6000 \times 8 = 32k + 48k = 80k$$
Ratio $$A:B = 84:80 = 21:20$$
Total = 41. Profit = 4600? Not integer divisible. 
Let's check ratio calculation. $$5000 \times 4 = 20000$$. Added 3000 => 8000. $$8000 \times 8 = 64000$$. Sum = 84000.
B: $$8000 \times 4 = 32000$$. Withdrew 2000 => 6000. $$6000 \times 8 = 48000$$. Sum = 80000.
Ratio $$84:80 = 21:20$$. Sum = 41. 
Adjust profit to Rs. 4100.
A's Share = $$2100$$.

questions.text: The length of a train is 150m. It crosses a bridge of length 250m in 20 seconds. Find the speed of the train in km/hr.
questions.solution:
Total distance = 400m.
Speed = $$400/20 = 20$$ m/s.
km/hr = $$20 \times 18/5 = 72$$ km/hr.

questions.text: A shopkeeper sells an article at a loss of 10%. If he had sold it for Rs. 50 more, he would have gained 15%. Find CP.
Ratio of milk and water in a mixture is 7:3. If 20 liters of water is added, the ratio becomes 7:5. Find the initial quantity of milk.
questions.solution:
Milk constant = 7 units.
Water increase = 5 - 3 = 2 units.
2 units = 20L => 1 unit = 10L.
Milk = 7 units = 70L.
